titleInfo.title: Moving library collections : a management handbook
The Greenwood library management collection,; Variation: Greenwood library management collection.

mods.abstract: Abstract: "Moving a library is a mammoth task that requires precise, long-range planning. This book is a comprehensive guide to making that move a smooth one. Filled with practical advice culled from reports on more than a hundred moves, it addresses the needs of libraries planning to use a moving company or moving themselves. Habich gives the library move planner the analytical tools and knowledge of procedures necessary for carrying out the move effectively and efficiently."--BOOK JACKET. Contents: Foreword / Lee B. Brawner -- I. Planning Collection Space. 1. Determining the Size of Existing Collections. 2. Planning for Growth. 3. Preparing a Collection Layout Plan -- II. Planning the Collection Move. 4. General Considerations -- III. Using a Moving Company. 5. Library and Mover Responsibilities. Library and Mover Responsibilities from a Mover's Perspective / Michael J. Kent. 6. Preparing a Request for Proposal (RFP). 7. Selecting a Mover. 8. Carrying out the Move: Working with a Mover -- IV. Doing the Move Yourself. 9. Planning Move Logistics. 10. Executing the Move Yourself -- V. Special Topics. 11. Moving Library Collections: Pest Management Control Issues / Agnes Quigg. 12. Cleaning Collections / Joyce Frank Watson.
